title: PESU RR CSE
content:
Seniors in PES RR, how is the CSE Program there overall- The staff, exams, facilities, crowd, opportunities.
Seeing some negative points as a whole about the college such as “it’s very strict, don’t join” I’m asking this in particular.
Is it really as unpleasant as some people say it is or is it about some particular branch/staff etc.
How would an average student find pes?

comments.body: Pes is like school 8-3:15 types (timings may differ). There is 75% attendance requirement. Assignments and projects need to be submitted on time. Some clubs are there if you want to join.  Scholarships are there for top 5% and top 20%. Most lessons are video taped if you want to hear it. All slides are available on their web site. That's pretty much it. If you want to have fun, then it's up to you. College has rules of no copying. It's fair enough
competitive though..but placements have good record
